column3: Concept ACK. A quick skim of the code LGTM.
ACK fa3e94a3353dbbed98a15dd538fe87c153b821e9 -- patch looks correct and misbehaving peers should not be able to cause us to write to disk
Please excuse the repeated force pushes. There has been a windows cross compile failure, which should now be fixed.

Looks good to me. Validation errors, definitely for network-received transactions, should not spam the log with errors by default. I thought we had caught all of these by now but apparently not, good catch.\nThe refactor seems unrelated but looks like a good (and zero risk) change to me.\nACK fa492895b572a1196ca8652006b6fc2fa1d16951
For transactions this has been fixed in #18990 and should be complete. For blocks, this pull is the first step (incomplete)
